title: Calories in Sunflower Seeds
meta_description: Learn calories in sunflower seeds per 100g, including full nutrition facts like fats, protein, carbs, fiber, and quick serving tweaks for better tracking.
assumptions: Dry-roasted, unsalted, shelled sunflower seeds; standard kernel variety.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, roast type, whether shelled, added oils/salt, and portion size. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 100g of dry-roasted sunflower seeds pack about 584 kcal, mainly from healthy unsaturated fats and 21g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

faqs.q: How many calories in 1 oz of sunflower seeds?
faqs.a: About 163 kcal for 28g (1 oz) of dry-roasted sunflower seeds.

faqs.q: Are sunflower seeds high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, 51.5g total fat per 100g, but mostly healthy unsaturated fats.

faqs.q: How much protein in sunflower seeds?
faqs.a: Around 20.8g protein per 100g, making them a good plant-based source.
Yes, about 8.6g dietary fiber per 100g, aiding digestion.

faqs.q: Calories in shelled vs unshelled sunflower seeds?
faqs.a: Similar per edible kernel weight; unshelled includes inedible hulls, so measure kernels for accuracy.
